heisig_chinese_memo: I'm too (ii) sick and tired of everybody today.&nbsp
Ru_trainchinese: nì: (прил) жирный; липкий, скользкий; гладкий; пресытившийся
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When two bodies are together for too long they will of course get sick and tired of each other.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " meat ", the sound of " two " means thick and greasy. "Shuowen": "Fat on the top. From the meat, the second sound." Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yaoshu‧ Prepared": "Whenever you take it, take the fat first. The fat is greasy and not durable."

" Greasy " can mean smooth and delicate. "Songs of the Chu: Calling the Soul": "Supple face is tired of rationality, but will be more awkward." Wang Yi's note: "Luxury, Zhiye. Greedy, slippery.

" Greasy " also means sticky. The Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie's "Qi Min Yao Shu‧ Kind of Red and Blue Gardenia": "White rice noodles are as big as jujubes, but as much as they are, they are white. Those who are not greasy with bamboo chops will be painful for a long time."

" Greasy " also means marks and dirt. Jin Panyue "Emperor's Complaints": "The hands have not been changed, and I am as greasy as before."

" Tired " also means too much and boredom. "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 60: "I'm afraid there will be days when I get tired of shopping."

" Greasy " also describes the fog, which makes people feel fuzzy. Ming Xu Hongzu's "Xu Xiake's Travels‧Diary of Huangshan Mountain": "The four mountains are in fog, and the northeast of the nunnery is open, and the southwest is very greasy."
humanum_short_description_en: From " meat " to " two " sound, it means fat and greasy.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「貳」聲，表示肥厚、油膩。《說文》：「上肥也。从肉，貳聲。」 北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧脯腊》：「每取時，先取肥者。肥者膩，不耐久。」

　　「膩」可表示滑澤、細膩。《楚辭‧招魂》：「靡顏膩理，遺視矊些。」王逸注：「靡，緻也。膩，滑也。」

　　「膩」亦指黏膩。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧種紅藍花梔子》：「下白米粉大如酸棗，粉多則白。以淨竹箸不膩者，良久痛攪。」

　　「膩」也表示跡印、污垢。晉潘岳〈皇女誄〉：「手澤未改，領膩如初。」

　　「膩」還表示過多、厭煩。《紅樓夢》第60回：「只怕逛膩了的日子還有呢。」

　　「膩」也形容霧氣瀰漫，使人感到模糊。明徐弘祖《徐霞客游記‧游黃山日記》：「四山霧合，少頃，菴之東北已開，西南膩甚。」
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，「貳」聲，表示肥厚、油膩。

(Simplified: 腻)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 貳 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 貳 [ èr ] two (bankers' anti-fraud numeral)
①食物的油脂過多：油膩。肥膩。膩人。
②光滑，細緻：細膩。
③煩，因過多而厭煩：膩煩。膩味。玩膩了。
④黏：膩糊(“糊”讀輕聲)。
⑤積污，污垢：塵膩。

(Simplified: 腻)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 貳 indicates the sound; ⺼ (flesh) conveys the meaning.
HSK: 6
Freq: 6695
Chinese: I'm too (ii) sick and tired of everybody today. 
Meaning: sick and tired of
Hanzi: 腻
Story: When two bodies are together for too long they will of course get sick and tired of each other.
Kind: traditional

從「 肉 」，「 貳 」聲，表示肥厚、油膩。《說文》：「上肥也。从肉，貳聲。」 北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧脯腊》：「每取時，先取肥者。肥者膩，不耐久。」 「 膩 」可表示滑澤、細膩。《楚辭‧招魂》：「靡顏膩理，遺視矊些。」王逸注：「靡，緻也。膩，滑也。」 「 膩 」亦指黏膩。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧種紅藍花梔子》：「下白米粉大如酸棗，粉多則白。以淨竹箸不膩者，良久痛攪。」 「 膩 」也表示跡印、污垢。晉潘岳〈皇女誄〉：「手澤未改，領膩如初。」 「 膩 」還表示過多、厭煩。《紅樓夢》第60回：「只怕逛膩了的日子還有呢。」 「 膩 」也形容霧氣瀰漫，使人感到模糊。明徐弘祖《徐霞客游記‧游黃山日記》：「四山霧合，少頃，菴之東北已開，西南膩甚。」
From " meat", the sound of " two" means thick and greasy. "Shuowen": "Fat on the top. From the meat, the second sound." Jia Sixie of the Northern Wei Dynasty "Qi Min Yaoshu‧ Prepared": "Whenever you take it, take the fat first. The fat is greasy and not durable." " Greasy" can mean smooth and delicate. "Songs of the Chu: Calling the Soul": "Supple face is tired of rationality, but will be more awkward." Wang Yi's note: "Luxury, Zhiye. Greedy, slippery. " Greasy" also means sticky. The Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie's "Qi Min Yao Shu‧ Kind of Red and Blue Gardenia": "White rice noodles are as big as jujubes, but as much as they are, they are white. Those who are not greasy with bamboo chops will be painful for a long time." " Greasy" also means marks and dirt. Jin Panyue "Emperor's Complaints": "The hands have not been changed, and I am as greasy as before." " Tired" also means too much and boredom. "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 60: "I'm afraid there will be days when I get tired of shopping." " Greasy" also describes the fog, which makes people feel fuzzy. Ming Xu Hongzu's "Xu Xiake's Travels‧Diary of Huangshan Mountain": "The four mountains are in fog, and the northeast of the nunnery is open, and the southwest is very greasy."

膩字的基本解释

膩
nì
见“腻”。

膩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［nì］
［《廣韻》女利切，去至，娘。］
“腻1”的繁体字。
(1)肥厚；油腻。
(2)今多指食品中油脂过多，使人厌食。
(3)滑泽；细腻。
(4)迹印；污垢。
(5)黏腻。
(6)引申为纠缠；过于亲密。
(7)过多；厌烦。
(8)使人厌恶；恶心。
(9)形容雾气弥漫，使人感到模糊。
(10)涂抹缝隙使平整。

膩字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　膩； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页994第05
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?女利切，音?。【說文】上肥也。【玉篇】垢膩也。【廣韻】肥膩。　又滑也。【宋玉·招魂】靡顏膩理。【註】膩，滑也。　【類篇】或作?。

膩字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
膩字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［nì］
["Guangyun" female Liqie, go to, mother. ]
The traditional characters of "greasy 1".
(1) Hypertrophy; greasy.
(2) Nowadays, it usually refers to the excessive oil in food, which makes people anorexia.
(3) Sleek; delicate.
(4) Traces; dirt.
(5) Sticky.
(6) The extension is entanglement; too close.
(7) Too much; bored.
(8) Disgusting; disgusting.
(9) Describes that the fog is diffuse and makes people feel fuzzy.
(10) Apply the gap to make it smooth.
